title: 110_s1672
content: The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 establishes the Visual Impairment and Orientation and Mobility Professionals Education Assistance Program under Chapter 80 of title 38, United States Code. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 establishes a scholarship program to provide financial assistance for individuals studying visual impairment or orientation and mobility. The purpose is to increase the supply of qualified blind rehabilitation specialists for the Department and the Nation. The scholarship program established under the VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 aims to increase the supply of qualified blind rehabilitation specialists for the Department and the Nation. The Secretary will publicize the program to educational institutions nationwide, with a focus on institutions with high numbers of Hispanic students and Historically Black Colleges and Universities. Applicants must submit an application and agreement for participation, committing to a period of obligated service in return for educational assistance. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 establishes a scholarship program to increase blind rehabilitation specialists. Applicants must submit an application and agreement for participation, committing to a period of obligated service in return for educational assistance. Upon approval, individuals are notified and become participants in the program. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 establishes a scholarship program for blind rehabilitation specialists. Upon approval by the Secretary, individuals are notified and become participants in the program. Financial assistance covers tuition and fees necessary for the program of study. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 provides financial assistance for blind rehabilitation specialists to pursue dual certification or degree programs. The maximum amount of assistance for full-time students is $15,000 per academic year, and for part-time students, it is prorated based on their coursework. The total assistance provided under this chapter cannot exceed $45,000. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 offers financial assistance to blind rehabilitation specialists pursuing dual certification or degree programs. Full-time students can receive up to $15,000 per academic year, while part-time students receive prorated assistance. The total assistance provided cannot exceed $45,000. Assistance is available for a maximum of six years, and participants must sign a written agreement outlining their obligations and the Secretary's commitment to provide financial aid. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 provides financial assistance to blind rehabilitation specialists pursuing dual certification or degree programs. Participants must maintain enrollment, academic standing, and serve as a full-time employee in the Department for three years after completing the program. The Secretary may determine additional terms and conditions. Repayment is required for failure to meet the agreement requirements. Sec. 8005 of the VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 outlines the repayment requirements for individuals who fail to satisfy the agreement entered into under the program. The Secretary determines the amount of repayment and may grant exceptions under certain circumstances. Regulations are in place for waiver or suspension of obligations for noncompliance. The Secretary may waive or suspend repayment obligations under the VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 in cases of noncompliance due to circumstances beyond the individual's control. Repayment to the Secretary is considered a debt to the United States, not discharged by bankruptcy within five years of agreement termination. Clerical amendments are made to title 38 to reflect these provisions. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must implement chapter 80 of title 38, United States Code, within six months of the enactment of this Act.
